entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 651,262Chapters: 69/?Kudos: 89

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 436,740Chapters: 62/?Kudos: 27

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 269,269Chapters: 45/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: one single glimpse of relief
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 53,004Chapters: 10/20Kudos: 130

Summary: "What if I never get better? What if I always feel like this?" Buck finally looks back up at him, vulnerability and compassion clear on his too-expressive face. "I don't know," he says honestly. "I don't…" he shudders, gives a tiny shrug of his shoulders and tries again. "I don't have an answer for that, man. It's been seven months for me and I still feel…like this." "Like what?" Buck just shrugs again, then mumbles, "Not myself." And Eddie doesn't know what to say to that either, because this is the only version of Buck he's ever known.Or: Buck and Eddie meet at grief group.

entry.title: All I Want
entry.summary:
Author: UnlostDrarry

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,655Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 83

Summary: “You’re not my dad Buck so stop acting like it!,” Chris yelled, chest heaving at the admission. Buck felt his whole life flash before his eyes before he corrected his posture, stance tall, shoulders back, face neutral. “You’re right, I’m not your dad, but I’m still in charge of you until he gets home. He said you weren’t allowed to go to the party on a school night, and I passed along the message. If you have a problem with it, take it up with him when he gets home in twenty minutes,” Buck said calmly, leaving Chris’s room, closing the door behind him. Or. Buck gets into an argument with Chris and flees to visit Bobby’s grave. Eddie follows him to bring the man that he loves back home.

entry.title: going home, i'm going home to you
entry.summary:
Author: loversalwayslose

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,661Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: He actually avoided thinking about it as much as he could… death. He’d seen enough of it in his life. Of course, he wasn’t naive- he knew it was how the world works. Everyone has to go at one point… hell, he’d come close multiple times. But it still didn’t make it any easier. He supposed it wasn’t supposed to be… burying your husband. Athena had done it so, so long ago. Maddie had done it just last year. Buck should have known it would eventually happen to him, but again, selfishly, he had assumed it would be the other way around. He was supposed to go first. Not… Not Eddie.   or, the one with eddie's funeral (sorry not sorry)

entry.title: pretty in pink
entry.summary:
Author: Surakian

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,739Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 47

Summary: The vibrant hot pink material is supple as Eddie runs his fingers along the intricate flowery lace pattern. The see-through scalloped lace also has an open seam in the back all the way to the deep contoured pouch where a cock definitely goes. So, not women's panties. Eddie rolls his fingers across the material slowly, almost soothingly, and yet the blood in his veins pumps as though he were running a marathon. It almost feels like he's there but also like his mind is floating to the ceiling with the way he feels unmoored to his body. Eddie isn't sure how long he stood there with the lace panties in his hands, but it isn't until they are suddenly pulled from his hand that he fully comes to himself. "Whoops," Buck shouts as he steps into the room and stands in front of Eddie, shoving the panties into the pocket of his jeans as if that would hide their existence from Eddie. His face glows pink which makes his birthmark above his left eye stand out even more as it darkens into a rich red. entry.title: back between villages (and everything’s still)
entry.summary:
Author: kikibridges13

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,813Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 53

Summary: “I know this is difficult,” Angela continued. “But there is something else you need to know. The reason I’m calling.”Right, why was he getting a call from Child Protective Services after all? Unless...“Ali had a daughter,” Angela says. “Her name is Charlotte. She’s four.”Four.The number lands like a verdict. Four years. The same amount of time that had passed since he last spoke to Ali. Buck can feel his chest tighten, and he weakly removes his grip from the couch and up to his hand holding the phone. One. Two. Three.“She’s mine,” he whispered faintly.“Yes,” Angela confirmed. “Ali listed you as Charlotte’s biological father.”“I didn’t know,” Buck whispered. “I didn’t know.”***********Post 6x11 In Another Life. Buck is struggling after the lightning strike, and gets a phone call that flips his world upside down.Or, another girl!Dad Buddie story nobody asked for.

entry.title: The World Was On Fire, And No One Could Save Me But You...
entry.summary:
Author: InterrogateTheCat

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,850Chapters: 3/10Kudos: 92

Summary: Post LAWSUIT. Buck was given up by the Buckley parents, once Daniel died. He was given to Prescott Academy, a place they trained children to be assissians, they teach them at a young age. He left and became inactive in his early twenties, and became a firefighter instead. He kept his past to himself. That is until Hardman, his academy trainer shows up at the firehouse saying Agent 83 (Megan) has been taken, along with her husband Roger. Buck must keep Agent 83's (Megan) daughter safe. Buck gets reactived (Agent 81) to the mission, to find Agent 83, who was also his best friend since the academy. (You don't need to watch Barely Lethal to read this. I'll give enough context)

entry.title: When the Universe Screams
entry.summary:
Author: TheSunriseDove

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,150Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 58

Summary: “Wait, you’re not straight?” Buck asks and Eddie spins in shock. That has got to be one of the most ridiculous questions that Buck has asked him. And that’s saying something.“No, I’m not.” Eddie deadpans.“So what…are you?”“I’m in the wrong universe.” Or Eddie from canon universe switches places with Eddie from the universe where he confessed his love for Buck.

entry.title: The Promises We Made to Each Other (and the stars that helped us keep them)
entry.summary:
Author: dragoninthenewwarmmountain

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,222Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 4

Summary: Several weeks into their friendship, Eddie and Buck were sitting outside on Eddie’s porch, breathing in the summer air and bird songs. Eddie had been the first one to break the silence. “Do you ever feel like the stars are trying to lead you somewhere?” “All the time. That’s why I’m here - I’m looking for where they’re taking me.” Eddie tipped his shoulder so it was just grazing Buck’s and whispered “me too” And they sat under the glittering sky and both silently asked the stars to finish their message - to tell them why they’re here. OR Buck was a cowboy who retired to become a baker. Eddie is a schoolteacher who moves to California with his son. They both have a complicated relationship with the stars.
